Posts.Content: Donna, Hope you are doing o.k. now. I just read your message and noticed you have been on many of the same drugs as me. I have been on Adriamycin, Taxol, Taxatere, Novalbine, Doxil and now the Dr. wants me to start Gemzar on Friday. I just had 3 Doxil treatments and ended up with a severe skin reaction all over my body. I am very hesitant to try another drug but he wants to keep my cancer under control. My cancer is in lymph nodes in the back of my abdomen from breast cancer in 1983. Plese let me know how you are doing...Barb
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer to Lung

Posts.Content: Donna, Hope you are doing o.k. now. I just read your message and noticed you have been on many of the same drugs as me. I have been on Adriamycin, Taxol, Taxatere, Novalbine, Doxil and now the Dr. wants me to start Gemzar on Friday. I just had 3 Doxil treatments and ended up with a severe skin reaction all over my body. I am very hesitant to try another drug but he wants to keep my cancer under control. My cancer is in lymph nodes in the back of my abdomen from breast cancer in 1983. Plese let me know how you are doing...Barb
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer to Lung

Posts.Content: Any one out there having a problem with their insurance company covering Xeloda? My insurance won't cover it because it's not given at the Dr's office and its in pill form. All my other chemo drugs have been covered at 100%, I just paid the Dr. to administer them. Now I will be administering it myself by taking it orally and they won't cover it. I don't know if I will be able to afford it on a long term basis. If any of you had this problem, please let me know how you coped with it. I feel I don't deserve more stress in my life.
Posts.Title: Insurance Co. not paying for Xeloda

Posts.Content: Sandy, Thank you for your response. I did speak to the drug company and they were very nice, unfortunetly I do not qualify for their assistance program. It's not that I can't pay for the Xeloda, its the fact that other bills will hve to wait while I do. I did appeal with the decision to only cover Xeloda thru my prespcription plan and lost the appeal. Even though my medical plan covered all the other chemo drugs at %100 I have been on, because this is dispensed in pill form, medical does not cover it. So it costs me about $300 a month. it does not seem fair. Well, hope you are doing o.k. on Taxotere. I took that for a while and responded well to it. Best of luck!..Barb
Posts.Title: Insurance Co. not paying for Xeloda

Posts.Content: Julia, I have mets in my liver too from my breast cancer and was just told there are too many (14) for an operation. Chemo is my only shot. I started another round of chemo yesterday with Methotrexate. This will by 10th chemo drug. I just hope it works but I am not so sure. I was on Xeloda for 2 months and the tumors went from 1 to 14 so I am not very confident this drug will work. Good luck to you. What type of treatment are they recommending to you? Barb
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Is there anyone out there that is being treated for breast cancer and the Dr. is using the CA 27/29 tumor marker as a guide to active disease? I am gong thru my 4th different chemo regimen for inflamed lymph nodes in my abdomen from my breast cancer. In the past, my numbers have always gone down but now they are stalled and I have had 14 treatments of Navelbine and am getting frustrated. The Dr. wants to keep me on Navelbine a little longer since my latest CT scan is table and doesn't show any growth. Would love to hear from someone with a similar situation. Barb
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers Not Going Down

Posts.Content: My Dr. wants me to start on a Gemzar regiman this week after having a severe skin reaction to Doxil. I am told by the nurses at the chemo center, it is very tolerable but I do see side affects listed that worry including a rash. If any of you out there have had Gemzar, please share your experience with me. This will be my 6th chemo drug over the past 6 years for my breast cancer...Barb
Posts.Title: Anyone taking Gemzar?

Posts.Content: I am on my 4th chemo regiman (this time Navelbine)and in the past my tumor markers have always gone down with chemo. They did go up after my 1st treatment and now the have beeen stalled for 4 months and it has me concerned. The Dr. did say they can go up at first since the chemo is disrupting the bad cells like it should I guess that makes logical sense. Next week I see the Dr, and we will talk about possibly switching to another chemo drug or something...Barbara
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers Rise During Chemo

Posts.Content: Has anyone out there gotten a swollen mouth (gums, tongue) from Gemzar treatment. I am so uncomfortable and my Dr. says he only has one other patient that this has happened to and itwa related to heart medication reacting with the chemo. I am not on any heart meds, just miserable!
Posts.Title: Swollen Mouth

Posts.Content: Susan, I have been taking Faslodex shots since January. The only problem I have had is I am also on chemo (Navelbine) and when I get chemo and the shot on the same day, I am really dizzy on and off for the next couple of days. We started breaking them up and I think I'm better off that way. Unfortunetly, my tumor markers are not going down, as my Dr. hoped they would on Faslodex. I was on Tamoxifin, Arimidex, and Aromisen before Faslodex. The shot does hurt going in, but its only once a month. I hope it helps you get better...Barb
Posts.Title: Faslodex once a month shots

Posts.Content: Janice, i just took Faslodex for 9 months with chemo also. I was just taken off it since it did not seem to be helping. I was also on Tamoxifin, Aromison, and Arimidex first. My oncologist felt it was worth trying but also felt if one estrogen inhibitor drug didn't work, probably none of them would, but we gave it a chance. I hope you do o.k. on it...Barb
Posts.Title: Faslodex

Posts.Content: Wow, how strange, I was also fine for 15 years and then it came back. i am on chemo for the fifth time in 5 1/2 years. I hope this latest drug, Doxil will really help long term. I am really sick of all this but I know I need to keep trying to beat this rotten disease. I wish you all the best..Barb
Posts.Title: Faslodex

Posts.Content: Has anyone had a problem with skin reactions from Doxil treatment besides on their hands and feet? I woke up this week 3 days after treatment with bright, red burning skin on my thighs and buttocks. The Dr. said it is from Doxil but very unusual to be so localized in that area. I am taking a Medrol pack of predisone to see if it helps...Barb
Posts.Title: Doxil - Skin reaction
